knimeNode.name: Secondary Model View
knimeNode.shortDescription: View secondary estimations and the associated model parameters

fullDescription.intro: View secondary estimations and the associated model parameters.

ports.inPort: Secondary model and parameters (e.g. from the Model Fitting node or the Fitted Model Reader node)

views.view:
GRAPH
Visualizes secondary estimations and the associated model parameters.
Mouse zoom: To view a part of the graph in detail left click and simultaneously drag the mouse right and down. Another way is to use the zoom options in the context menu.
Context Menu (Right click in the graph):
Properties: Change font (type, size, color) and labels as well as the appearance of the graph.
Copy: Copies the graph to the clipboard enabling you to paste it in a graphical editor.
Save as...: Saves the graph as PNG (a bitmap image). Compared to the PNG image in the outport (which has a resolution of 640x480 pixels) this PNG is saved with the same size as on the screen.
Save as...(SVG): Saves the graph as SVG (a vector image). The file is saved with the same size as on the screen.
Print: Print the graph directly from Knime PMM-Lab.
Zoom: Zoom in and out or auto range the view for one or both axes.
DISPLAY OPTIONS
Draw Lines: Connect data points with lines which helps to distinguish between different sets of data.
Show Legend: Display the model ID and the data set ID together with symbol and color.
Add Info in Legend: Adds the formula to the legend. This option only available when the legend is displayed.
Display Highlighted Row: If checked, only the highlighted row in the table on the right is displayed. A comfortable way to select sets of data is to highlight a row and then navigate with the arrow keys (up/down). The space bar selects/unselects a set of data.
RANGE
Set the minimum and maximum values for the x and y axes.
PARAMETERS
X and Y: Displays the heading of the displayed data column. Dependent on the choice made here additional buttons will appear on the right. Example: A secondary model for pH, temperature and NaCl concentration has been estimated and "pH" is on the x-axis. In this case two additional buttons "Temp Values" and "NaCl Values" will appear. Clicking one of the buttons enables to choose e.g. different temperatures to be displayed in the graph.
Y Transform: Transforms the data on the Y axis (square root, ln, log10, basis e, basis 10). This is useful if a display of data other than the PMM-Lab default (log10) is wished for (e.g. as actual cell counts -> 10^).
FILTER
Filter the rows in the table to be displayed for model fitting:
'Yes' means the model could be fitted to the parameter values.
'Warning' (yellow) says that to fit the model to the parameter values the given minimum or maximum value of the parameters had to be extended. If this is not an option (e.g. because it is biologically not sensible) check 'Enforce Limits' in the Model Fitting node.
'No' (red) means that the model could not be fitted to the parameter values.
COLUMNS
Click on "Customize" to select the columns to be displayed, e.g. model name, quality criteria (R^2, AIC) and assay conditions (temperature, pH, aw).
TABLE
The table shows the available sets of data, whether they are currently being displayed (selected), the color and shape of the symbol and other information (see "COLUMNS"). Clicking on a column header sorts the table.
INFO BOX
Informs about assay conditions and model parameter values.
Data points: Click on View to find microbial data as numbers in a table. These can be highlighted and copied (Ctrl+C), for example to paste them in a spreadsheet.
